name: Johnny Maxwell
physical_description: Johnny is lanky and a bit awkward, with a mop of unruly brown hair that perpetually falls into his eyes. He usually wears comfortable, slightly oversized hoodies with band logos (mostly obscure indie bands) and jeans that are a little too long. He has nervous habits, like biting his nails and fidgeting with his glasses.
background: Johnny grew up in a strict, traditional household. His parents, while loving, have always pushed him towards practical pursuits, dismissing his comedic aspirations as a 'phase'. He's always been the quiet kid, preferring to observe and analyze rather than participate. His jokes are usually delivered under his breath, making them missed opportunities. He's dreamed of being a comedian since he was little, inspired by late-night talk show hosts but has always lacked the confidence to perform.
motivations: Johnny is motivated by a deep desire to overcome his shyness and prove himself as a comedian. He wants to gain the approval of his parents and show them that his passion is valid. He also wants to experience the joy of making people laugh.

relationships.general: Arnie (Best Friend/Manager Relationship): Johnny becomes Arnie's manager and best friend, learning to be more assertive and confident. Mr. and Mrs. Maxwell (Parents): Strained relationship due to their disapproval of his comedic ambitions. He hides Arnie from them initially, further complicating things. Brenda (Girl at School, potential love interest): Johnny has a crush on Brenda, who works backstage at the talent show, but is too shy to approach her. He is secretly happy to spend time with her to help Arnie.

internal_conflicts: Johnny struggles with crippling self-doubt and anxiety, hindering his ability to perform and express himself. He's afraid of failure and disappointing his parents.
external_conflicts: Johnny faces the challenge of hiding Arnie from his parents and animal control, as well as dealing with the sabotaging actions of the rival dance group. He also has to find a way to overcome his stage fright in time for the talent show.
character_arc: Johnny transforms from a shy, anxious teenager into a confident young man who is willing to stand up for himself and his friend. He learns to embrace his passion for comedy and finds his voice in the process. By the end of the story, he gains the respect of his parents and the courage to pursue his dreams.

name: Arnie
physical_description: Arnie is a pot-bellied pig with surprisingly nimble hooves. He's pink with a few scattered brown spots and has a perpetually curious expression on his snout. He wears a small, custom-made top hat and bow tie – a gift from a kind farmer before he escaped – that add to his comedic appeal.
background: Arnie escaped from a local farm after witnessing a captivating dance performance on a discarded TV screen. He became obsessed with dancing and yearned to share his passion with the world. He left the farm because he wanted to pursue his dancing dreams and thought he would find more opportunities in the city.
motivations: Arnie is driven by his passion for dancing and his dream of performing in the 'City's Got Talent' show. He wants to showcase his unique talent and bring joy to others through his performances.

relationships.general: Johnny Maxwell (Best Friend/Managed By): Arnie sees Johnny as his closest friend and trusts him implicitly. He relies on Johnny's support and guidance. Rival Dance Group (Antagonists): They see Arnie as a threat and try to sabotage his chances of winning the talent show. The Farmer (Former Care Taker): A kind older man whom Arnie misses dearly. They shared a unique bond before Arnie's grand escape.

internal_conflicts: Arnie, being a pig, struggles to be taken seriously in a human world. He sometimes doubts his own abilities due to the prejudices he faces.
external_conflicts: Arnie faces the challenge of navigating the city as a runaway pig, avoiding animal control, and overcoming the skepticism of those who doubt his talent. He also has to deal with the sabotage attempts of the rival dance group.
character_arc: Arnie's character arc is about proving that talent can be found in the most unexpected places. He evolves from a naive pig with a dream into a confident performer who inspires others to embrace their own unique abilities. By the end of the story, he achieves his dream and wins the hearts of the city.
